name: undelegated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a power, job, duty, or right) not given to someone: If the government assumes undelegated powers, its acts are void and of no force. The undelegated personal right is recognized in all the laws and charters of the world.
More examplesFewer examplesThe undelegated sovereignty of Christ makes it impossible for His saving grace to be manipulated by human mediation.The Supreme Court has the right to modify every power undelegated by the people.The Tenth Amendment insists that undelegated powers are retained by the people.
